document_data.name: ''Sword of the Dales''
document_data.Powers:
The sword granted the wielder to breathe underwater once per day, per the [[spell]] ''[[water breathing]]'', and possessed a command word. When the word ''merrydale'' was uttered, it would unlock any chains or manacles within 30 feet.

It was believed the sword possessed additional abilities, but even after [[identify|identification]], these had not been fully discovered.
document_data.History:
The sword was created by the weaponsmithing [[wizard]] [[Shraevyn]], in [[996 DR]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ericlboyd.com/dnd/monsters.html |title=Realms Bestiary, Volume 2 |accessdate=2008-06-20 |author=[[Thomas M. Costa]], [[Eric L. Boyd]] |format=PDF |date=August 2006 }} and interred it within his [[Shraevyn's Tomb|his tomb]] for a couple centuries.

Sometime around [[1369 DR]] the sword was briefly recovered by [[Randal Morn]] on an expedition that he and his [[Freedom Riders]] took into the [[Shraevyn's Tomb|tomb of Shraevyn]]. After Randal was abducted, and his men were killed and turned into [[undead]], the sword was used as bait in the tomb to draw adventurers into the machinations of [[Gothyl]]. This former [[wizard]] became an arch-[[shadow]] in her pursuit of [[lich]]dom and her essence was linked to the sword some time before it was discovered by the Dalesman.
